match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 7 wickets (with 58 balls remaining)
match.hoursInfo: 09.00 start, First Session 09.00-12.30 Interval 12.30-13.15, Second Session 13.15-16.45

headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sunil Narine lbw b Sohag Gazi 36 (45b 3x4 0x6 61m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: end of the innings as Narine goes for the sweep and misses, struck in line of middle and leg, and Gazi has his fourth wicket, what a debut it has been for him, 4 for 29, good effort from Narine as well, his career-best score of 36

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Sohag Gazi
dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Tamim Iqbal b Sohag Gazi 35 (40b 4x4 2x6 54m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Gazi has struck, the massive wicket of Gayle, it was a terrific catch by Tamim Iqbal at long-on, Gayle takes on long-on, but he can't hit it long enough, it was in the slot to be hit though, I thought Tamim was going to miss that one but he pedals back a few steps and leaps to pluck that overhead chance, makes sure he doesn't ground the ball as he lands, gets up and signals that's out, what a start for Gazi

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gazi has struck, the massive wicket of Gayle, it was a terrific catch by Tamim Iqbal at long-on, Gayle takes on long-on, but he can't hit it long enough, it was in the slot to be hit though, I thought Tamim was going to miss that one but he pedals back a few steps and leaps to pluck that overhead chance, makes sure he doesn't ground the ball as he lands, gets up and signals that's out, what a start for Gazi
Samuels has been caught at slip, drives with a bit more effort this time and gets the outside edge against one that went on straight, thick edge and Mahmudullah took it on the second attempt at slip

headshotImage.caption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: another catch at long-on, as soon as the batsman played that the bowler screamed 'Catch' (with about 20 'A's), Thomas stepped out of the crease and thumps that one, but not far enough, the simplest of the takes at long-on today

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: end of the innings as Narine goes for the sweep and misses, struck in line of middle and leg, and Gazi has his fourth wicket, what a debut it has been for him, 4 for 29, good effort from Narine as well, his career-best score of 36

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Pollard is gone, to a delivery that he could have hit anywhere he liked, a short one, Pollard pulls, straight to midwicket, the man there didn't need to move, Pollard even had the courtesy of hitting it at a nice catchable height, Bangladesh celebrate, Pollard swings his bat in disgust

Andre Russell doesn't move his feet at all as he looks to chop the ball from middle and off, that one slides on and diesn't turn away, perhaps the cut was not the best shot to play there, he's cramped and can't get bat on ball, bowled him

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Rampaul looks to sweep that one, he was far too early on the shot, off the gloves and the ball pops up for the keeper, finally the ninth wicket goes down

dismissalText.commentary: Lendl Simmons lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 13 (25b 2x4 0x6 47m) SR: 52

dismissalComment.html: there's the wicket, looked plumb that one, shortish slower one, Simmons had shuffled across and looked to tuck that to the leg side from the crease, he misses and is struck on the knee roll, in front of middle, that would have taken out leg stump, Bangladesh strike

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Sohag Gazi

dismissalComment.html: Gazi has struck, the massive wicket of Gayle, it was a terrific catch by Tamim Iqbal at long-on, Gayle takes on long-on, but he can't hit it long enough, it was in the slot to be hit though, I thought Tamim was going to miss that one but he pedals back a few steps and leaps to pluck that overhead chance, makes sure he doesn't ground the ball as he lands, gets up and signals that's out, what a start for Gazi

dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels c Mahmudullah b Sohag Gazi 0 (9b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Samuels has been caught at slip, drives with a bit more effort this time and gets the outside edge against one that went on straight, thick edge and Mahmudullah took it on the second attempt at slip

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard c Mashrafe Mortaza b Abdur Razzak 15 (24b 2x4 0x6 36m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: Pollard is gone, to a delivery that he could have hit anywhere he liked, a short one, Pollard pulls, straight to midwicket, the man there didn't need to move, Pollard even had the courtesy of hitting it at a nice catchable height, Bangladesh celebrate, Pollard swings his bat in disgust

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo run out (Sohag Gazi/Mahmudullah) 35 (41b 4x4 1x6 59m) SR: 85.36

dismissalComment.html: Khulna roars in delight, they sense an upset here, Thomas played that one just behind square leg, there's a massive mix-up, Bravo is stranded halfway, he makes a desperate dash back, it isn't a direct hit, but there is still time to run him out, West Indies 102/5, Bravo had run two-thirds the way before realising Thomas wasn't going anywhere

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Daren Sammy c Naeem Islam b Mahmudullah 10 (17b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: the second superb catch at long-on today, Sammy is gone now, a length ball that Sammy wanted to murder over long-on, again it was a touch opportunity for the man in the deep, Naeem Islam jumps to collect it and lands a yard within the rope, Sammy walks off shaking his head

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Pollard b Narine 58 (51b 8x4 2x6 57m) SR: 113.72

dismissalComment.html: Narine has got the breakthrough! bowling from round the wicket, the ball spins away from Tamim, who looks to power that over backward point, can't beat the man there, easy catch ends the first-wicket stand at 88

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Naeem Islam not out 50 (79b 6x4 0x6 107m) SR: 63.29

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh lose their second, Anamul looks to pull a shortish ball, gets a top edge and the ball lobs to wait Sammy, end of a good debut innings from Anamul
he's gone, a soft dismissal, goodish length and he opened the face to just chip it towards Pollard at point, the easiest of catches and Nasir's gone for a well-made cameo

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: it's over, Bangladesh have thumped West Indies in the opening game, Mushfiqur finishes it off with a pull for four, plenty of beaming faces in the crowd, the Bangladesh players are fairly composed though, a hug before shaking hands with some of the West Indies players, Mushfiqur walks off chatting with Marlon Samuels

commentPostTextItems.html: Four debutants in the game, and no Shakib Al Hasan, but Bangladesh were never in any trouble, especially after West Indies opening partnership was broken.

The shot selection of some of the West Indies batsmen will be questioned, and the general intensity was not at the level the visitors will want. The bowling too was lacklustre, but with too many deliveries down the leg-side and plenty short and wide.

A terrific win for Bangladesh, who have often been in control of games for brief spells before letting it slip. There were no slips today, as Bangladesh coasted to victory with little sign of any hiccup. The packed house at Khulna couldn't have asked for anything more.

Darren Sammy: "We just didn't execute today, there is no sense of panic in the dressing room. There are four games to go, I am sure we can come back. We didn't bat as well as we can, some of the guys got starts but didn't go on. Our bowling was not as good as it could have been. Credit to Bangladesh, they had a plan, they stuck to it, and they deserved to win."

Mushfiqur Rahim: "We dedicate our win to Islam Rana and our countrymen who died in the recent fire. Our quicks set the platform, the spinners backed them up. The Test there was a couple of individual performances but not combined. Today we played as a team, so I am happy. We know they will come back hard in the next match, we are ready for them."
Sohag Gazi is the Man of the Match, on debut.
Here's Siddhartha Talya match report. We'll have more analysis from Mohammad Isam soon.
That's it from me today, party on Bangladesh.

commentTextItems.html: a 50 for Naeem Islam, pushes the ball towards sweeper cover for another single, he has been unruffled all of today
worked towards square leg for one more

commentPostTextItems.html: Here's a list of Bangladesh's biggest victories in ODIs.

commentTextItems.html: on the pads, another single, this time to square leg
eased towards mid-on for a single
more defence, no rush from Bangladesh
blocked towards the leg side
Narine starts his spell with a length ball on off stump
short and a bit of width, guided down to the third-man boundary for four

commentTextItems.html: on the pads, and that is sent down towards fine leg, 11 to go
West Indies have offered far too many short balls this innings, this one is put away towards midwicket for four
drives it towards mid-off
short and outside off, eased towards sweeper cover
length ball heading for off stump, defended
almost played at that outside off ball, withdraws the bat at the last instant

commentTextItems.html: pitched up and that is driven towards cover off the front foot
length ball is dabbed towards cover
bouncer just outside off, easily evaded by the batsman
short of length and outside off, whacked behind point for four, again giving the Bangladesh batsmen too much width
length ball is blocked to the right of the non-striker

headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: end of the innings as Narine goes for the sweep and misses, struck in line of middle and leg, and Gazi has his fourth wicket, what a debut it has been for him, 4 for 29, good effort from Narine as well, his career-best score of 36

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Pollard is gone, to a delivery that he could have hit anywhere he liked, a short one, Pollard pulls, straight to midwicket, the man there didn't need to move, Pollard even had the courtesy of hitting it at a nice catchable height, Bangladesh celebrate, Pollard swings his bat in disgust

Andre Russell doesn't move his feet at all as he looks to chop the ball from middle and off, that one slides on and diesn't turn away, perhaps the cut was not the best shot to play there, he's cramped and can't get bat on ball, bowled him

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Rampaul looks to sweep that one, he was far too early on the shot, off the gloves and the ball pops up for the keeper, finally the ninth wicket goes down

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the second superb catch at long-on today, Sammy is gone now, a length ball that Sammy wanted to murder over long-on, again it was a touch opportunity for the man in the deep, Naeem Islam jumps to collect it and lands a yard within the rope, Sammy walks off shaking his head

headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lendl Simmons lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 13 (25b 2x4 0x6 47m) SR: 52

dismissalComment.html: there's the wicket, looked plumb that one, shortish slower one, Simmons had shuffled across and looked to tuck that to the leg side from the crease, he misses and is struck on the knee roll, in front of middle, that would have taken out leg stump, Bangladesh strike

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Sohag Gazi
dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Tamim Iqbal b Sohag Gazi 35 (40b 4x4 2x6 54m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Gazi has struck, the massive wicket of Gayle, it was a terrific catch by Tamim Iqbal at long-on, Gayle takes on long-on, but he can't hit it long enough, it was in the slot to be hit though, I thought Tamim was going to miss that one but he pedals back a few steps and leaps to pluck that overhead chance, makes sure he doesn't ground the ball as he lands, gets up and signals that's out, what a start for Gazi

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels c Mahmudullah b Sohag Gazi 0 (9b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Samuels has been caught at slip, drives with a bit more effort this time and gets the outside edge against one that went on straight, thick edge and Mahmudullah took it on the second attempt at slip

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard c Mashrafe Mortaza b Abdur Razzak 15 (24b 2x4 0x6 36m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: Pollard is gone, to a delivery that he could have hit anywhere he liked, a short one, Pollard pulls, straight to midwicket, the man there didn't need to move, Pollard even had the courtesy of hitting it at a nice catchable height, Bangladesh celebrate, Pollard swings his bat in disgust

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo run out (Sohag Gazi/Mahmudullah) 35 (41b 4x4 1x6 59m) SR: 85.36

dismissalComment.html: Khulna roars in delight, they sense an upset here, Thomas played that one just behind square leg, there's a massive mix-up, Bravo is stranded halfway, he makes a desperate dash back, it isn't a direct hit, but there is still time to run him out, West Indies 102/5, Bravo had run two-thirds the way before realising Thomas wasn't going anywhere

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Daren Sammy c Naeem Islam b Mahmudullah 10 (17b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: the second superb catch at long-on today, Sammy is gone now, a length ball that Sammy wanted to murder over long-on, again it was a touch opportunity for the man in the deep, Naeem Islam jumps to collect it and lands a yard within the rope, Sammy walks off shaking his head

dismissalComment.html: Andre Russell doesn't move his feet at all as he looks to chop the ball from middle and off, that one slides on and diesn't turn away, perhaps the cut was not the best shot to play there, he's cramped and can't get bat on ball, bowled him

headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sunil Narine lbw b Sohag Gazi 36 (45b 3x4 0x6 61m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: end of the innings as Narine goes for the sweep and misses, struck in line of middle and leg, and Gazi has his fourth wicket, what a debut it has been for him, 4 for 29, good effort from Narine as well, his career-best score of 36

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Pollard b Narine 58 (51b 8x4 2x6 57m) SR: 113.72

dismissalComment.html: Narine has got the breakthrough! bowling from round the wicket, the ball spins away from Tamim, who looks to power that over backward point, can't beat the man there, easy catch ends the first-wicket stand at 88

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c & b Sammy 41 (62b 7x4 0x6 87m) SR: 66.12

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh lose their second, Anamul looks to pull a shortish ball, gets a top edge and the ball lobs to wait Sammy, end of a good debut innings from Anamul

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Naeem Islam not out 50 (79b 6x4 0x6 107m) SR: 63.29

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Pollard b Russell 28 (29b 4x4 0x6 37m) SR: 96.55

dismissalComment.html: he's gone, a soft dismissal, goodish length and he opened the face to just chip it towards Pollard at point, the easiest of catches and Nasir's gone for a well-made cameo

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim not out 16 (22b 3x4 0x6 39m) SR: 72.72

stories.title: Spinners set up big Bangladesh win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 1st ODI, Khulna
stories.seoTitle: Spinners set up big Bangladesh win
stories.summary: Darren Sammy wanted West Indies to win the ODI series 5-0, but his team's batting revealed a self-destructive ability in the opening game in Khulna that shut out any hopes of a clean sweep
